resources.string: Classical elements typically refer to Ancient Greek concepts, such as those of Empedocles, similar to the modern states of matter. Aristotle added a fifth element or quintessence called aether in Ancient Greece, and akasha in India. The concept of the five elements formed a basis of analysis in both Hinduism and Buddhism, in ancient China and Japan. Certain words and images associated with each element.
Earth represents things that are solid.
Water represents things that are liquid.
The basest element, Earth, created using all the other elements, and can be perceived by all five senses – hearing, touch, sight, taste, and smell.
Air can be heard and felt.
Water has no odor, but can be heard, felt, seen and tasted.
Fire can be heard, felt and seen.
